metadata.synopsis: Default dialogue - the conversation you can have with Shadowheart at any time when she's a member of your party. You can ask her about herself, or events that you've experienced together during your adventures. Her responses to you may differ slightly depending on her current attitude towards you.

6.speaker: Shadowheart
6.text: I... I think so, but I don't know why. That name on the tomb meant nothing to me, yet I felt a pang of loss all the same.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Surely not someone you know? What Sharran would be buried out there?
104.context: NodeContext: 'Reminiscing'/deducing a part of her past that she can't truly remember.

41.speaker: Shadowheart
41.text: You'd be surprised - not all of us don robes and dark armour. Some people live perfectly normal lives on the surface, blending in utterly, so that they can serve the Dark Lady in utter secrecy.
41.context: NodeContext: 'Reminiscing'/deducing a part of her past that she can't truly remember.

126.speaker: Shadowheart
126.text: And not every skill that the Dark Lady asks of her followers can be taught in the shadows. Some can only be mastered on the streets, in daylight, amidst crowds.
126.context: NodeContext: 'Reminiscing'/deducing a part of her past that she can't truly remember.

144.speaker: Shadowheart
144.text: Lying, tailing, observing without being seen, picking a purse without being felt... I think I must have been sent to learn all these things from the man in that grave.
144.context: NodeContext: 'Reminiscing'/deducing a part of her past that she can't truly remember.

110.speaker: Shadowheart
110.text: 'Allister Marnley'. Sounds human, and the grave wasn't recent. He must have died some time ago. And I mourned him already.
110.context: NodeContext: 'Reminiscing'/deducing a part of her past that she can't truly remember.

95.speaker: Shadowheart
95.text: He'd surely not have been buried here if he was exposed - he must have taken the secret of his faith to the grave, undiscovered. A very Sharran ending.
95.context: NodeContext: 'Reminiscing'/deducing a part of her past that she can't truly remember.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: What do you think it means?
124.context: NodeContext: 'Reminiscing'/deducing a part of her past that she can't truly remember.

82.speaker: Shadowheart
82.text: I think I knew that man. I think he helped me somehow, long ago, and I grieved when he died.
82.context: NodeContext: 'Reminiscing'/deducing a part of her past that she can't truly remember.

5.speaker: Shadowheart
5.text: Not all of Sharrans don robes and dark armour. Some people live perfectly normal lives on the surface, blending in utterly, so that they can serve the Dark Lady in utter secrecy.
5.context: NodeContext: 'Reminiscing'/deducing a part of her past that she can't truly remember.

11.speaker: Shadowheart
11.text: That's a question that could take a lifetime to answer. Lady Shar's followers are my responsibility now. I will need to guide them, and root out any heresy that Viconia sowed.
11.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar (sacrificed and forgot her parents to become the new leader of the Shar Grotto)

133.speaker: Shadowheart
133.text: But all that must wait for now - the Nightsinger's church cannot thrive if the Absolute isn't stopped.
133.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar (sacrificed and forgot her parents to become the new leader of the Shar Grotto)

16.speaker: Shadowheart
16.text: When the time comes for the final battle, Lady Shar's faithful will be ready. Until then, we should continue to do what we must.
16.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar (sacrificed and forgot her parents to become the new leader of the Shar Grotto)

17.speaker: Shadowheart
17.text: My parents are still captive. I need to free them.

135.speaker: Shadowheart
135.text: I can very easily imagine I needed somewhere to escape to, if I was to survive.
135.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Considering a child she can't remember.

108.speaker: Shadowheart
108.text: Nocturne and I must have come here a lot. We probably had plenty we wanted to hide from.
108.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Considering a childhood she can't remember. Nocturne = long lost friend

85.speaker: Shadowheart
85.text: I don't think I was always alone there either... I remembered a friend, when I ate the noblestalk. I think we hid from our troubles, together.
85.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Considering a childhood she can't remember.

45.speaker: Shadowheart
45.text: I have the strangest feeling that I wasn't always alone there... don't ask me why, but I almost sense the conversations, the laughter.
45.context: NodeContext: Strangest feeling that she's missing something (she had a real friend here, who she's failed to find/remember)

44.speaker: Shadowheart
44.text: Perhaps I had an imaginary friend. Wouldn't surprise me.
44.context: NodeContext: Strangest feeling that she's missing something (she had a real friend here, who she's failed to find/remember)

121.speaker: Shadowheart
121.text: Anyway, I think that little hideaway helped shape who I am, as much as any sermon or training did. Funny, the things that influence you...

28.speaker: Shadowheart
28.text: Everything that's happened... Shar, my parents... it's almost too much to take in.
28.context: NodeContext: Anticipation. On the cusp of her final reward.

31.speaker: Shadowheart
31.text: The Chamber of Loss beckons. Lady Shar has one final task for me, then all of this will be mine.
31.context: NodeContext: Anticipation. On the cusp of her final reward.

32.speaker: Shadowheart
32.text: You probably would have been well-rewarded by her if you hadn't just told me that. I owe you.
32.context: NodeContext: Weary. Needs a little space.

33.speaker: Shadowheart
33.text: I... I haven't had a chance to figure that part out just yet. What happened barely feels real to me. I had my family back, for such a short time... and now they're gone again.
33.context: NodeContext: Weary. Needs a little space.

51.speaker: Shadowheart
51.text: Give me a night, to try and get my head together.
51.context: NodeContext: Weary. Needs a little space.

39.speaker: Shadowheart
39.text: Those that are worth remembering, yes. Lady Shar is ever-wise; she knows what I do and do not have to know in order to be her most loyal, most effective servant:
39.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar (sacrificed and forgot her parents to become the new leader of the Shar Grotto)

97.speaker: Shadowheart
97.text: My training knowledge, my experiences, my will and faith... everything I need to be leader of the cloister.
97.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar (sacrificed and forgot her parents to become the new leader of the Shar Grotto)

58.speaker: Shadowheart
58.text: Anything that's missing... well, I can't miss what I can't remember. I have all I need.
58.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar (sacrificed and forgot her parents to become the new leader of the Shar Grotto)

2.speaker: Player
2.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar (sacrificed and forgot her parents to become the new leader of the Shar Grotto)

61.speaker: Shadowheart
61.text: Not as much as I am. My whole life has been leading up to this. At last, I've become who I've always meant to be.
61.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar (sacrificed and forgot her parents to become the new leader of the Shar Grotto)

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Are you sure? Feels like a compromise.
20.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar (sacrificed and forgot her parents to become the new leader of the Shar Grotto)

134.speaker: Shadowheart
134.text: What in life isn't? I consider myself blessed to have a goddess guide my very mind.
134.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar (sacrificed and forgot her parents to become the new leader of the Shar Grotto)

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Shar is manipulating you, still. Keeping you loyal, by making you forget.
102.context: NodeContext: 'not this again' Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar (sacrificed and forgot her parents to become the new leader of the Shar Grotto)

13.speaker: Shadowheart
13.text: You've been with me all this time... you know exactly what I've sacrificed to achieve this. I had hoped you'd learned to not try and sour my relationship with Lady Shar, but clearly not. Let us speak no more of this.
13.context: NodeContext: 'not this again' Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar (sacrificed and forgot her parents to become the new leader of the Shar Grotto)

138.speaker: Player
138.text: What about us - do you still remember all we've been through?
138.context: NodeContext: Warm. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar (sacrificed and forgot her parents to become the new leader of the Shar Grotto)

87.speaker: Shadowheart
87.text: Of course. From the first time I laid eyes on you, right until now. That's all safe - I wouldn't surrender even a moment of it.
87.context: NodeContext: Warm. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar (sacrificed and forgot her parents to become the new leader of the Shar Grotto)

47.speaker: Shadowheart
47.text: I do. The Mother Superior will have ordered them to keep watch for my return. Find one, and we discover what comes next.
47.context: NodeContext: Considering what memories were and were not restored to her. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and saved her parents.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: So you don't even know where to go?

36.speaker: Shadowheart
36.text: Not quite. Above all else, protecting our base of operations in Baldur's Gate was the reason I had to surrender my memories to begin with... or at least, that's what I was led to believe.

113.speaker: Shadowheart
113.text: We should look for someone to point me in the right direction, otherwise we'll have little recourse but to wander the whole city, searching.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I think I'd quite like to get lost with you, exploring the city.

111.speaker: Shadowheart
111.text: I know what you mean. And under different circumstances, I'd like that too. But first things first, I'm afraid.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: What should we be looking for?

53.speaker: Shadowheart
53.text: Wyrm's Crossing is a chokepoint - if I wanted to intercept a new arrival, I'd find somewhere before the bridge, blend in amongst the crowds, and wait.

79.speaker: Shadowheart
79.text: Most people seeking entry to the city will be refugees. I'd look wherever they're gathering.

12.speaker: Shadowheart
12.text: Difficult to say. I've strayed from my original mission, but Lady Shar has given me a new one. Time will tell if my peers recognise that... the Mother Superior has a tight grip on them - one that I intend to break.

101.speaker: Shadowheart
101.text: If by warm, you perhaps mean a flaming arrow? I doubt they'll attack in public. No, I expect they'll point me in the right direction so I can face my reckoning away from prying eyes.

30.speaker: Shadowheart
30.text: It's overwhelming - like a lifetime's worth of nightmares, unleashed all at once upon waking. I can barely untangle one moment from another - not that I even want to.
30.context: NodeContext: Considering what memories were and were not restored to her. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and saved her parents.

63.speaker: Shadowheart
63.text: I just know that my heart sinks if I let my thoughts wander to them...
63.context: NodeContext: Considering what memories were and were not restored to her. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and saved her parents.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: They'll fade with time. They always do.
69.context: NodeContext: Considering what memories were and were not restored to her. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and saved her parents.

40.speaker: Shadowheart
40.text: Perhaps. But in the meanwhile, I'll just have to find a way to live with them.
40.context: NodeContext: Considering what memories were and were not restored to her. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and saved her parents.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Shar did that for no other purpose but sheer spite?
68.context: NodeContext: Considering what memories were and were not restored to her. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and saved her parents.

67.speaker: Shadowheart
67.text: Shar seeks to break people, to fill their lives with despair, so that they will turn to her for relief. Perhaps she thought this would lead me back to her in time...
67.context: NodeContext: Considering what memories were and were not restored to her. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and saved her parents.

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: But it won't. I fought too hard to win my freedom - I will not give it up again. No matter how much it hurts.
42.context: NodeContext: Undaunted. Considering what memories were and were not restored to her. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and saved her parents.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Perhaps your parents can help you get over these memories.
88.context: NodeContext: Finding some solace. Considering what memories were and were not restored to her. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and saved her parents.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Perhaps your parents can help you get over these memories.
35.context: NodeContext: Finding some solace. Considering what memories were and were not restored to her. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and saved her parents.

116.speaker: Shadowheart
116.text: I spoke to my father already. It was difficult... but I think it helped. I'm better equipped to deal with my past now.
116.context: NodeContext: Finding some solace. Considering what memories were and were not restored to her. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and saved her parents.

9.speaker: Shadowheart
9.text: Yes... but it's not an easy subject to broach. Those bad memories... they're filled with my parents' faces, their cries of pain. But perhaps it will help, if I can clear the air...
9.context: NodeContext: 'Good point'. Considering what memories were and were not restored to her. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and saved her parents.

56.speaker: Shadowheart
56.text: That graffiti from before - I never thought I'd see it again...
56.context: NodeContext: Some incredulity. Saw a bit of graffiti and had a strong deja vu moment as a result.

106.speaker: Shadowheart
106.text: Well... I think I was the one who did it.

25.speaker: Shadowheart
25.text: I can recognise my own handwriting... how long ago was this? Years?

129.speaker: Shadowheart
129.text: All the time I spent training, hidden away from the world. I think... I think I must have wanted to leave my mark somewhere - just to prove I existed. Even to myself...
129.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Minor evidence of a past she can't remember has come to her attention.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: It didn't seem all that memorable to me.

120.speaker: Shadowheart
120.text: It was to me - I think I was the one who did it.

57.speaker: Shadowheart
57.text: The final sacrifice has been made. I am Lady Shar's right hand now. It has all been worth it - every step, every trial, every drop of blood...

112.speaker: Shadowheart
112.text: None. She sealed her own fate - I was merely Lady Shar's instrument in delivering the final blow.

10.speaker: Shadowheart
10.text: Still, I learned much from the late Mother Superior. It was the least I could do to make that final blow a swift one.
10.context: NodeContext: faint hint of affection to the late Viconia.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: Viconia is still out there, somewhere.

122.speaker: Shadowheart
122.text: She is alone and powerless. Lady Shar has denounced her, and her own followers have abandoned her. Perhaps she will come to regret her survival, but either way, I do not expect to see her again.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: What about Nocturne? Can you be both her leader, and her friend?

0.speaker: Shadowheart
0.text: Of course. What's the point in having power if you cannot wield it every now and again to help your friends?

46.speaker: Shadowheart
46.text: Nocturne has endured much in this place, and remained loyal to me. Once I have settled into my role, I shall see that whatever place she desires in Lady's Shar's service is hers.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: What does this mean for us? The bond we share?

34.speaker: Shadowheart
34.text: That... that was always a fragile, elusive thing, ever since I slew Nightsong.

49.speaker: Shadowheart
49.text: I did not want to surrender it then. Perhaps now, as first among Lady Shar's children, I can give myself leave to do as I like...

60.speaker: Shadowheart
60.text: I hope so. So long as I'm willing to stroll right into the Mother Superior's trap, they have no reason to not tell me where to go.
60.context: NodeContext: Considering what memories were and were not restored to her. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and saved her parents.

73.speaker: Shadowheart
73.text: I need to reach its very centre, and confront the Mother Superior. Lady Shar decrees she is no longer fit to lead.
73.context: NodeContext: Considering what memories were and were not restored to her. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and saved her parents.

19.speaker: Shadowheart
19.text: There will be plenty of others there too - if we can get them to see sense, I would rather we spare their lives. I don't want to lead a congregation of corpses like Balthazar and Ketheric.

76.speaker: Shadowheart
76.text: Most are lost forever. Some may creep back into my mind, if I encounter anything that helps clear the fog... then there's what Shar did restore to me. Memories of pain, suffering. Both my own, and what I inflicted.
76.context: NodeContext: Considering what memories were and were not restored to her. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and saved her parents.

77.speaker: Shadowheart
77.text: That... doesn't sound like the Mother Superior I remember. But then again, I can scarcely trust what I do remember.
77.context: NodeContext: A little unsure, though she wants to believe

86.speaker: Shadowheart
86.text: I trust you. Lead the way.

84.speaker: Shadowheart
84.text: Everything that's happened... Shar, my parents... it's almost too much to take in.
84.context: NodeContext: Considering what comes next. Arc: rejected Shar and savedher parenrts.

92.speaker: Shadowheart
92.text: A chance to breathe, hopefully. This has all been... very draining.
92.context: NodeContext: Considering what comes next. Arc: rejected Shar and savedher parenrts.

93.speaker: Shadowheart
93.text: Baldur's Gate... it's amazing how a place I don't truly remember feels so familiar.

96.speaker: Shadowheart
96.text: Just wandering the streets is causing little things to come back to me. Just the barest crumbs of memories, but still... I suppose when you're famished, a crumb is a feast.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: There's nothing stopping you and I from making new memories, of course...

37.speaker: Shadowheart
37.text: Oh, I'm well aware, trust me. In fact, as I remember so little the way things stand, all my fondest memories revolve around you.

21.speaker: Shadowheart
21.text: Honestly - and don't laugh - it's the smells. I never thought I'd be so glad to be greeted by the waft of docks and alleyways.

29.speaker: Shadowheart
29.text: It doesn't dredge up any specifics... just a feeling I can't quite define. But it's a comforting feeling, all the same.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: There was something else I wanted to talk about.

94.speaker: Shadowheart
94.text: More than remember it - I think I did it.

100.speaker: Shadowheart
100.text: That... doesn't sound like the Mother Superior I remember. Are you sure?

105.speaker: Shadowheart
105.text: Well, can you imagine what it would have been like, growing up in that place? Endless training, no privacy, facing scorn wherever I looked...
105.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Considering a child she can't remember.

115.speaker: Shadowheart
115.text: Then that's where we need to go. My parents are in there somewhere.

119.speaker: Shadowheart
119.text: That sounds like a trap if I ever heard one.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: You can trust me - I wouldn't have spoken of it if I didn't believe it.

141.speaker: Shadowheart
141.text: All right. When you're ready, lead me there.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I think it's genuine. Even your Mother Superior would be a fool to deny your greatness.

24.speaker: Shadowheart
24.text: And she is no fool, from what I remember of her... all right. When you're ready, lead me there.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Perhaps she wishes to cut her losses. With you lost to Shar, your parents are of little use.

3.speaker: Shadowheart
3.text: She could cut her losses far easier by just killing them. But trap or not, what choice do I have? When you're ready, lead me there.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: All I know is what she told me. It's up to you to act on it.

75.speaker: Shadowheart
75.text: You're right. I'm sorry - it's been difficult to take much for granted lately, especially when it comes to Sharrans. When you're ready, lead me there.

127.speaker: Shadowheart
127.text: That little hideaway that we found in the cloister... it almost felt like I'd found a piece of my childhood. A childhood I don't truly remember.
127.context: NodeContext: Fond/wistful. Discovered her old childhood hideaway.

117.speaker: Shadowheart
117.text: But remember it or not... I felt right at home there, surrounded by books and night orchids.
117.context: NodeContext: Fond/wistful. Discovered her old childhood hideaway.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: Why did you even need a hideaway?
145.context: NodeContext: Fond/wistful. Discovered her old childhood hideaway.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Want to go and spend some more time there?
83.context: NodeContext: Fond/wistful. Discovered her old childhood hideaway.

118.speaker: Shadowheart
118.text: Don't tempt me. I might find it hard to leave.
118.context: NodeContext: Fond/wistful. Discovered her old childhood hideaway.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Perhaps that's why you like night orchids - some part of you remembered them from your little sanctuary.
90.context: NodeContext: Fond/wistful. Discovered her old childhood hideaway.

103.speaker: Shadowheart
103.text: Maybe. Or maybe I already liked night orchids, and I chose that place because of them.
103.context: NodeContext: Fond/wistful. Discovered her old childhood hideaway.

74.speaker: Shadowheart
74.text: The particulars of childhood can grow hazy, even if your memories haven't been tampered with. But I felt safe there - I know that much.
74.context: NodeContext: Fond/wistful. Discovered her old childhood hideaway.

128.speaker: Shadowheart
128.text: My parents. I saw them, spoke to them... and let them go. It's... it's more than I can take in, just now.

137.speaker: Shadowheart
137.text: That name on the tombstone before - it meant nothing to me, yet I felt a pang of loss all the same...

139.speaker: Shadowheart
139.text: And as you're telling me this, I assume you intend to do no such thing? It seems my trust in you is well-placed.

55.speaker: Shadowheart
55.text: Perhaps I shouldn't expect the warmest of receptions when I return to my people - no doubt the Mother Superior seeks to cling to power.

48.speaker: Shadowheart
48.text: But I must go there, all the same. And I'd better be prepared for anything.

125.speaker: Shadowheart
125.text: I just hope you don't have a last-minute change of heart, and decide to take her offer after all.

78.speaker: Shadowheart
78.text: I should have anticipated the Mother Superior would try something like this; have me walk right into a trap.

140.speaker: Shadowheart
140.text: Is that so? I'm a little surprised you decided to warn me - it must have been a scant bounty you were offered. Still, I should thank you.
